results.title: The Marketplace
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Dispels the notion that one cannot make a living in photography with the emphasis on taking a creative approach in order to do so. A range of experts in the field from the director of a gallery, a photojournalist, commercial photographer and mountain climbing photographer, Galen Rowell discuss their careers and approaches.

results.title: The Market economy: A matter of choice
results.brief_description: Shows how the competitive market system satisfies the needs of consumers in our modern economy. It looks at the market economy in Australia with the traditional Keynesian interpretation.

results.title: The Mark of Zorro
results.creator_credit: Douglas Fairbanks Pictures and Fred Niblo
results.brief_description: Douglas Fairbanks stars as the unassuming Don Diego de la Vega, son of a wealthy Spanish Californian rancher. Don Diego has a secret identity, for when he dons a mask and cape he is transformed into Zorro. Zorro is the only hope citizens have for protection against the evil Captain Juan Ramon (Robert McKim). Of course, as in all swashbuckling tales there is a pretty damsel involved. Lolita (Marguerite de la Motte), is in love with Zorro but thinks little of Don Diego. To complicate matters Juan Ramon is vying for the affections of the lovely Lolita. Noah Beery Senior plays a supporter of Juan’s until he joins the good guys and aligns himself with Zorro. This is the first of many film versions of Johnston MacCulley’s 1913 adventure story, “The Curse of Capistrano”.

results.title: The Mark of the Hand : Aubrey Williams
results.creator_credit: Henry Martin, Kuumba Productions and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: The film follows Aubrey Williams to Georgetown, the capital city of Guyana, where he is to restore one of his murals. But this visit is special as Aubrey is to travel on to Hosororo in the far north-west of the country, where forty years earlier he worked as an agricultural officer. It was then that he first came into contact with pre-Columbian art in the form of rock painting or “Timehri”, an Arawak word that translates literally as “the mark of the hand”. His experiences there were decisive in forming his identity as a painter and have remained a creative source for his paintings.

results.title: The Maritime provinces of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of maritime provinces of Canada in relation to the rest of Canada and t the United States of America. Fishing, fur-farming, together with population distribution and a glimpse of the history of each settlement. The emphasis is placed on fishing off the coastline of Prince Edward island, and lumbering in new Brunswick.

results.title: The Marco Polo: Queen of the seas
results.creator_credit: Sam Grana, ONF | NFB and Roger Hart
results.brief_description: For lovers of ships, particularly the golden age of sailing ships, “The Marco Polo: Queen of the seas” is a fascinating documentary. The ship began its career as a timber freight carrier but became a passenger ship which carried emigrants to Australia. Produced by the acclaimed National Film Board of Canada, this program uses archival footage and dramatisations to recreate the era.

results.title: The Marble
results.brief_description: A boy of eight possesses a wonderful marble which has magical powers. With it he is powerful, but he loses it down a sewer. The marble passes from person to person until the boy finally retrieves it.
